00019 #include <ulib/base/base.h>
00020 #include <ulib/debug/macro.h>
00021 
00022 #ifdef DEBUG
00023 #  include <ulib/debug/trace.h>
00024 #  include <ulib/debug/common.h>
00025 #  include <ulib/debug/objectDB.h>
00026 #  include <ulib/debug/error_memory.h>
00027

00032 
00033 // Manage memory pool
00034 
00035 #include <stdlib.h>
00036 
00037 #ifdef U_MEMORY_POOL
00038 #  include <ulib/internal/memory_pool.h>
00039 
00040 #  define U_MEMORY_ALLOCATOR \
00041         void* operator new(  size_t sz)  { U_INTERNAL_ASSERT(sz <= U_MAX_SIZE_PREALLOCATE); return UMemoryPool::pop(U_SIZE_TO_STACK_INDEX(sz)); } \
00042         void* operator new[](size_t sz)  { return UMemoryPool::_malloc(sz); }
00043 #  define U_MEMORY_DEALLOCATOR \
00044         void  operator delete(  void* ptr, size_t sz) { U_INTERNAL_ASSERT(sz <= U_MAX_SIZE_PREALLOCATE); UMemoryPool::push(ptr, U_SIZE_TO_STACK_INDEX(sz)); } \
00045         void  operator delete[](void* ptr, size_t sz) { UMemoryPool::_free(ptr, sz); }
00046 
00047 #  define U_MALLOC(  sz)                                                        UMemoryPool::pop(      U_SIZE_TO_STACK_INDEX(sz))
00048 #  define U_FREE(ptr,sz)                                                        UMemoryPool::push(ptr, U_SIZE_TO_STACK_INDEX(sz))
00049 
00050 #  define U_MALLOC_TYPE(  type)         (type*) UMemoryPool::pop(      U_SIZEOF_TO_STACK_INDEX(type))
00051 #  define U_FREE_TYPE(ptr,type)                                 UMemoryPool::push(ptr, U_SIZEOF_TO_STACK_INDEX(type))
00052 
00053 #  define U_MALLOC_STR(sz,capacity)                             UMemoryPool::_malloc_str(sz, capacity)
00054 #  define U_FREE_STR(ptr, sz)                                           UMemoryPool::_free_str(ptr, sz)
00055 
00056 #  define U_MALLOC_N(  n,type)          (type*) UMemoryPool::_malloc(   (n) * sizeof(type))
00057 #  define U_FREE_N(ptr,n,type)                                  UMemoryPool::_free(ptr, (n) * sizeof(type))
00058 
00059 #  define U_MALLOC_VECTOR(  n,type) (type**) UMemoryPool::_malloc(   (n) * sizeof(type*))
00060 #  define U_FREE_VECTOR(ptr,n,type)          UMemoryPool::_free(ptr, (n) * sizeof(type*))
00061 #else
00062 #  define U_MAX_SIZE_PREALLOCATE 4096
00063 
00064 #  define U_MEMORY_ALLOCATOR
00065 #  define U_MEMORY_DEALLOCATOR
00066 
00067 #  define U_MALLOC(  sz)                                         U_SYSCALL(malloc, "%u", sz)
00068 #  define U_FREE(ptr,sz)                                         U_SYSCALL_VOID(free, "%p", ptr)
00069 
00070 #  define U_MALLOC_TYPE(  type) (type*) U_SYSCALL(malloc, "%u", sizeof(type))
00071 #  define U_FREE_TYPE(ptr,type)                  U_SYSCALL_VOID(free, "%p", ptr)
00072 
00073 #  define U_MALLOC_STR(size,capacity)    U_SYSCALL(malloc, "%u", (capacity = size))
00074 #  define U_FREE_STR(ptr, sz)                            U_SYSCALL_VOID(free, "%p", ptr)
00075 
00076 #  define U_MALLOC_N(  n,type)                   new type[n]
00077 #  define U_FREE_N(ptr,n,type)          delete[] ptr
00078 
00079 #  define U_MALLOC_VECTOR(  n,type)              new type*[n]
00080 #  define U_FREE_VECTOR(ptr,n,type)              delete[] ptr
00081 #endif
00082 
00083 // string representation (for gcc compiler strict aliasing problem...)
00084 
00085 /* in this way we don't capture the event 'dead of source string with child alive'...
00086 #define U_SUBSTR_INC_REF
00087 */
00088 
00089 typedef struct ustringrep {
00090 #ifdef DEBUG
00091         ustringrep* _this;
00092 #endif
00093 #if defined(U_SUBSTR_INC_REF) || defined(DEBUG)
00094         ustringrep* parent; // manage substring for increment reference of source string
00095 #       ifdef DEBUG
00096         int32_t child;            // manage substring for capture event 'DEAD OF SOURCE STRING WITH CHILD ALIVE'...
00097 #       endif
00098 #endif
00099         int32_t references;
00100         uint32_t _length, _capacity;
00101         const char* str;
00102 } ustringrep;
00103 
00104 class UStringRep;
00105 
00106 union uustringrep {
00107         ustringrep* p1;
00108         UStringRep* p2;
00109 };
